title: BBC Local Live: Herefordshire & Worcestershire Friday 31 March 2017 - BBC News
summary: respite centre for children with disabilities closes its doors .
marathon run by postman injured in dog attack .
climbers scale cliffs to clean up beauty spot .

text: extreme litter on climbing rocks

documents.title: grand fountain back on after repairs
text: grand fountain back on after repairs

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: on tv : digby v rigby on brexit
text: nine months since the referendum and article 50 has finally been triggered .
the west midlands voted to leave more enthusiastically than any other region of the uk .
i 'll be hearing from , among others , leaver , the worcestershire-based lord digby jones ( and remainer , sir peter rigby .
you can hear the debate on bbc sunday politics midlands - from 11:00 on bbc one .
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: basketball : wolves take on eagles
text: there 's basketball action at the university arena in worcester tonight as the worcester wolves take on the newcastle eagles in the bbl .
tip off is at 19:30 .

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast
text: find out what the weekend has in store .
you can also get latest forecasts at any other time from the .
bbc weather website .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: boy 's racecourse 'marathon ' by boy to raise money for injured jockeys
text: an 11-year-old horse racing fanatic made his debut at hereford racecourse this morning but he was n't on a horse .
james clarkson has set himself the challenge of running around all 34 national hunt racecourses in england in a week - and today he 's been in hereford .
he 's raising money for the injured jockeys fund , and is being ferried around the courses by his father , edward .
the first three days were really good fun , but now i 'm getting a bit tired .
i 've done around 40 miles and i 've been going for four days and it 's sort of caught up on me . ''
he was cheered on by the champion jockey richard johnson at hereford .

documents.title: open habitats restored on the malvern hills
text: the malvern hills conservators are the charity who look after the hills , and they 've been busy working with the environment agency to clear areas .
thanks @ twitterid for brilliant day 's work on # malvernhills restoring open habitats .
meadow pipits and beefly also send thank you 's : )

documents.title: new trust builds on partnership between hanley castle , hanley swan and kempsey schools
text: a new trust has been launched to strengthen an existing partnership between three worcestershire schools .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: travel : advance notice of road closure
text: part of barbourne road in worcester will closed for resurfacing work on sunday .
closure of barbourne road # worcester inbound direction only this sun 2 apr & sun 9 apr for resurfacing - diversion via rainbow hill
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: museum reopens after 'major refurbishment '
text: the black and white house museum in hereford will reopen tomorrow after a `` major refurbishment '' , the council says .
the museum is based in an original jacobean museum dating back to 1621 and was at one time a bank .
the musuem shows what life was like in hereford during the 17th century , using recreated rooms , original furniture and everyday family items .
there is also an activity area and dressing up room for children .

documents.title: delight as public votes helps school win cash to fix their flooded field
text: community spirit has helped a lickey school win vital cash to patch-up their flooded playing field , which has been so boggy children have not been able to play on it .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: when tackles go wrong # peoplescup
text: just how did those legs end up there ?
find out with our top 10 magic moments from last weekend 's fa people 's cup semi-finals .
for more fa people 's cup action , watch our semi-final highlights programme , .
available on the iplayer from 06:00 bst on saturday morning , 1 april , and on the red button at 13:50 bst and repeated throughout the weekend .

documents.title: football : bulls ordered to replay abandoned fixture
text: hereford fc have been told by the league that they will have to replay their fixture against didcot town , which was abandoned in march after crowd trouble .
the bulls were leading 2-1 when the incident took place in the 87th minute .
a date has yet to be decided for the rearranged fixture , the club say .

documents.title: hos announces new boss
text: st richard 's hos has announced its care director , june patel , will be the charity 's new chief executive .
mrs patel will replace mark jackson , who is retiring after holding the role for more than 10 years .
the hos based in worcester , supports more than 2,500 patients and family members in worcestershire each year .

documents.title: hero driver explains how he spotted a man stuck under a lorry
text: the driver who first spotted a man stuck underneath a lorry in hereford yesterday said a culmination of luck prevented a horrible tragedy .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: slideshow : blossoms and blackbirds
text: as the sun breaks through the clouds across herefordshire and worcestershire , bbc weather watchers have been out with their cameras .
thanks to postman les , hillman , cloudgazer and j at severn ridge for the photos .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: safe driving app welcomed by police chief
text: a virtual reality app aimed at promoting road safety is being rolled out across the west mercia force area .
the drivevr app allows people to be in a virtual driver 's seat , and looks at driving challenges including speeding , mobile phones , drink driving , drug driving and passenger distractions .
it is being delivered to around 5,000 young people each year as part of the green light programme .
too many people are killed or seriously injured on our roads , in collisions which could have been prevented .
education is vitally important to ensure everyone understands the impact of making a decision which puts road users at risk . ''

documents.title: emaciated dog found at half its proper weight piles on the pounds
text: a stray dog rescued when he was half his ideal weight is now back to almost full health , according to the charity which took him in .
vegas , a three-year-old doberman , weighed only 24kg ( 50lbs ) when he arrived at the dogs trust centre in evesham .
he had to be gradually built back up to his correct weight as his stomach would n't have been able to cope with a sudden increase in food , the trust says .
vegas has now been adopted by dog lover yasmin tredell ( above ) , but still needs regular check-ups by a vet .
vegas is one spoilt pup and so different to the dog i first met a few months ago .
he has made such amazing progress , growing so much in confidence despite what he must 've been through . ''

documents.title: postman injured in dog attack plans memorial marathon
text: a hereford postman will run the london marathon in memory of his mother , despite injuring his pelvis in a dog attack .
mike chandler is raising money for the breast cancer haven in the city , in honour of his mother who died from the disease when he was only 16 .
he 's now back in training after being badly hurt last year .
a dog came out of a farm house and came chasing towards me .
i did not have time to turn and run .
although during the dog attack i did manage to kick him off without getting bitten , i did fall very heavily on to concrete on my left hip bone which went straight up on to my spine . ''

documents.title: mobile phone driving convictions : motorists still not getting the message
text: west mercia police say there are still drivers using mobile phones at the wheel , despite tougher penalties being introduced .
about two offences a day have been recorded by the force since the start of the month when fines increased to £ 200 and points rose from three to six .

there are people who are driving at speed and still texting or listening to calls , and then there are other people who are going into slow moving traffic , coming up to traffic lights , vehicles are more or less stationary , and they the phone up .
both can cause accidents . ''

documents.title: leisure centre backs kidderminster dementia campaign
text: the new wyre forest leisure centre will be doing its bit to support people living with dementia after signing up to an initiative .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: tour series cycle race : town stands to make more than £ 400k
text: staging a tour series cycle race in redditch in may could bring more than £ 400,000 into the local economy , the council says .
that 's the amount visitors and competitors spend locally on accommodation , food and souvenirs when the race was staged in the town last year , according to worcestershire county council .
this year 's race takes place on 9 may and will be covered on tv .
we are proud to be showcasing redditch as a place to visit .
the tour series will see thousands of visitors coming to the town to enjoy the race and we hope they also make the most of what our town has to offer while they 're here . ''

documents.title: respite centre closure : 'families still have a range of options '
text: herefordshire 's respite care centre for children with mental and physical disabilities will close its doors for the last time today , despite a long campaign from families who say it 's their lifeline .
the number one ledbury road centre was due to close last april before herefordshire council allocated £ 600,000 to keep it open for an extra 12 months .
there are providers for short breaks within herefordshire , these are above the opportunities for using acorns [ children 's hos and other providers .
there are providers who are showing an interest in providing even more services in herefordshire , but these have n't been announced yet . ''

documents.title: slideshow : spring skies and scudding clouds
text: there have been some very mixed skies about this morning , as you can see from this selection of images from bbc weather watchers .
this selection come from the wolster , coco cholet , mikesnapper , sunshine seeker and postman les .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: help us find the dunkirk cook who fed our dad
text: a veteran 's son is searching for information about a hero cook of the dunkirk campaign , who kept his father , and other troops , brilliantly well fed under enemy fire .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: watch : anger over cycle race road closures
text: businesses on the route of a planned 100-mile cycle ride say it will cost them thousands of pounds worth of lost trade .
roads across herefordshire and worcestershire will be closed to traffic for the entire day .
about 15,000 riders are expected to take part in velo birmingham in september , which will pass through places such as belbroughton , cutnall green , martley , bromyard and bewdley .
the organisers and worcestershire county council say they will work with local people and businesses to minimise disruption .
author: Ben Sidwell
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: respite centre closure : 'i do n't know how there are going to take it '
text: families in herefordshire say the closure of the county 's only respite centre for children will leave them without a much-needed lifeline .

the number one ledbury road centre , which cares for children with mental and physical disabilities , will close for good today , after being kept running part-time for a year by a £ 600,000 grant from herefordshire council .
melissa boyle 's two children , fergus and gwen ( both spend time at the centre - she say 's she want to see `` proper provision in the county , not miles and miles away '' .
it 's been very difficult - we 've just started talking it through with them .
i do n't know how they are going to take it .
i 'm concerned about how this will affect their well being because they will be anxious not knowing what 's around the corner . ''
the council says it is working with families , professionals and providers to ensure short-break opportunities are available to families .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: west mercia police make use of tougher mobile laws
text: two mobile phone offences per day have been recorded by west mercia police , since tougher penalties were introduced at the beginning of this month .
the new government rules mean drivers face a £ 200 fine and six penalty points if they 're caught using a mobile behind the wheel .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : climbers go litter at beauty spot
text: dozens of climbers will be taking part in an extreme litter this weekend , hundreds of feet above the ground on the crags and cliffs at symonds yat , in herefordshire .
they 'll be removing litter , checking and replacing safety pegs and tidying up loose rock and invasive plants .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: respite centre for children closes its doors
text: a respite centre that cares for children with mental and physical disabilities is closing for good today .
number one ledbury road in hereford is the last centre of its type in herefordshire .
families will now have to choose from alternative care including acorns in worcester and sites in wales .
up to 25 children are cared for at the centre , which was due to close last april , before herefordshire council allocated £ 600,000 to keep it open part-time for an extra 12 months .
the council says it has has been `` working closely with families , professionals and providers over an 18-month period to ensure a wide range of short-break opportunities are available '' .
families unhappy with the services available can take a direct payment instead to `` allow them to access services they feel better suit their needs , '' the council added .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a cloudy and damp start to the day , the clouds should clear , leaving a drier and brighter afternoon with highs of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

a damp start to the day , but there 's nicer weather to come - this of the morning sky was taken in ashton-under-hill by bbc weather watcher , morning amble .

text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: tenbury warning on housing benefits
text: a benefits charity says that people living in tenbury and the teme valley are not always getting the help that they are entitled to receive .
author: Ludlow & Tenbury Wells Advertiser

documents.title: watch : the west midlands weather forecast for tonight and tomorrow
text: after a cloudy day with some sunshine around , here 's how the weather 's looking for tonight and friday morning .
you can also get latest forecasts at any other time from the bbc weather website .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: pedestrian rescued from under lorry suffers 'serious injuries '
text: a pedestrian who was rescued from under a lorry in hereford city centre has been airlifted to hospital with `` serious injuries '' , the ambulance service say .
the emergency services were called to wall street in hereford shortly after 15:00 - the fire service had to rescue the man using hydraulic equipment .
west midlands ambulance service say the man , who is in his 50s , suffered serious injuries to his abdomen , back and feet .
an air ambulance which was attending a charity event at the nearby edgar street football ground , the home of hereford fc , took the injured man to the queen elizabeth hospital in birmingham .
we were proud to be able to help @ twitterid today as they attended an accident near by .
thoughts to those involved .

documents.title: share of £ 60m fund for community-led housing developments
text: two councils have given a share of a £ 60m government fund to support community-led housing developments .
wychavon district council has been given just over £ 250,000 and malvern hills district council just over £ 168,000 .
the fund will allow local community groups to help deliver affordable housing on sites which are `` likely to be of less interest to mainstream house builders '' , .
malvern hills district council says .

documents.title: phew what a scorcher
text: temperatures in pershore ( below right ) today have reached the dizzy heights of 21c ( 70f ) , according to rebecca wood , who does the forecasts on midlands today .
that 's warmer than it is in barcelona ( below left ) , which is a chilly 19c ( 66f ) , according to the met office .
and those temps are continuing to rise 21c/70f at # pershore # worcestershire now !
hot stuff
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: slideshow : the sun has got his hat on
text: the weather has taken a turn for the better this afternoon , as you can see from these taken by bbc weather watchers .
thanks to jenny wren , punxutawney phil , toppo , caravanjo and the wolster for the images .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: pedestrian rescued from under a lorry
text: a pedestrian has had to be rescued from under a lorry by firefighters using hydraulic equipment .
the emergency services were called to the roundabout near to debenhams in hereford at about 15:00 .
a man in his 50s has been airlifted to the queen elizabeth hospital in birmingham , west midlands ambulance service says .
the extent of his injuries have not yet been released .
15:09 a438 # hereford .
pedestrian trapped under lorry , rescued by @ twitterid w/ hydrofusion lifting equipment , timber cribbing

documents.title: cycle race closures : local residents promised they will be able to get out
text: people living on the route of a major cycle ride will be able to get out of their homes , despite the roads being closed for nine hours , the highways manager for worcestershire county council says .

jon fraser says the county council and officials in herefordshire will be able to manage people out of their properties during the one-day birmingham velo event , which passes through wolverley , bewdley , bromyard , martley and cutnall green .
about 15,000 riders are expected to take part in the event , which takes place in september .
velo birmingham says road closures are necessary to guarantee the safety of the cyclists , and that it 's working with local businesses to minimise disruption .

documents.title: police investigate report of man carried on car bonnet in sidbury
text: police are investigating an incident in which a pedestrian was carried along on a car bonnet in sidbury , worcester .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: rugby : warriors ' academy star signs first-team contract
text: hooker jack singleton has signed a new deal that will see him move to the first-team squad for next season , worcester warriors have announced .
the 20-year-old is a product of the club 's academy system - .
he made his aviva premiership debut against northampton saints in november and he has since gone on to make 17 appearances .
breaking news academy hooker @ twitterid has put pen to paper on a first-team deal !
# heretostay
amazing news .
warriors front row fortress keeps getting stronger .
# togetherwegrow
brilliant news .
congratulations on the deal jack !
# future # originalg

documents.title: your 'seagull proof ' rubbish bags
text: the `` seagull proof '' bags are part of a 10-year campaign by herefordshire council to reduce the number of gulls in the city centre .
the council says the number of breeding pairs has dropped from 500 breeding pairs to about 150 during the campaign .
our trade waste sack customers can now be provided with a free seagull-proof sack .
to apply call 01432 260000 :

documents.title: severn valley railway from the footplate of the flying scotsman
text: you can enjoy a driver 's eye view from the footplate of the flying scotsman as it made its way along the severn valley railway , from kidderminster to bridgnorth .
the programme is on bbc four tonight at 22:00 .

documents.title: your town gets new cctv camera
text: the council has been putting up a new cctv camera in upton-upon-severn .
new cctv has gone up in upton upon severn this morning # dayofaction @ twitterid
what about malvern ?

documents.title: kidderminster shuttle back page : harriers ready to face vital halifax challenge
text: harriers ' boss john eustace says his players have recovered well from a tough run of games and will be raring to go for the visit of promotion rivals halifax this saturday .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: biomass fumes misery : 'it just seeps into the whole of the house '
text: residents in a worcestershire village says the fumes from nearby biomass boilers are making their lives a misery .
the boilers , in stoke prior near bromsgrove , are designed to produce renewable energy from burning wood chips and pellets .
[ there is ] constant smoke in our houses .
we go to [ our children 's ] bedrooms in the morning and there 's smoke in the bedrooms .
your throat is burning , your eyes are stinging and watering , your tongue is burning and when you breath your lungs are painful .
it makes you want to cry when you go in - you ca n't stop it , you ca n't move [ the children ] , it just seeps into the whole of the house . ''
bromsgrove district council says it has identified a number of breaches of planning rules and there will now be a public inquiry by a planning inspector .
biomass boilers operator intall fields farm has declined a bbc request to comment .

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : toad 'ladders ' to save amphibian lives
text: on midlands today this lunchtime , we 'll hear how there 's an experiment to try to stop frogs , toads and newts becoming trapped in roadside gullies being carried out in the region .
every year , millions of the creatures die this way but now volunteers are installing specially created ladders , which allow them to climb their way back to safety .
we 'll have more from 13:30 on bbc one .
author: Kevin Reide
Midlands Today

documents.title: kidderminster shuttle from page : crew plan u-turn
text: the kidderminster shuttle has the story of a u-turn over planned cuts at the local fire station .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: cricket : hastings makes first appearance for worcestershire
text: australian all-rounder john hastings will make his first appearance for worcestershire in a warm-up game in taunton .
the county 's overseas signing has recovered from patella tendon surgery .
worcestershire : mitchell d'oliveira fell whiteley rhodes hastings barnard leach ( c ) milton ( w ) tongue shantry morris

documents.title: spinal surgery teenager back in hospital
text: a herefordshire girl .
who returned from the usa at the weekend after potentially life-changing surgery .
has been re-admitted to hospital .
ella tomlinson , from leominster , had a specialist operation to help her severe curvature of the spine .
the family made the decision to travel for the surgery after st george 's hospitals trust , in south london , put the procedures on hold .
she 's now been treated for a lung problem and severe pain , at the hereford county hospital .

documents.title: watch : two-week ban for red card
text: worcester warriors ' director of rugby , gary gold , says the two-week ban for bryce heem was as good as the club could have hoped for in the current climate .
heem was red-carded at wasps for tacking willie le roux while the wasps player was in the air .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: drug dealer got high in the cells while he awaited jury 's verdict
text: a drug dealer from hereford got high in the cells while he awaited the jury 's verdict on a human trafficking trial .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: no lift at railway station
text: you wo n't be able to get on to platform one at worcester foregate street station by lift for the rest of the day .
the lift at platform 1 at # worcesterforegatestreet is out of order today .
we do apologise for any inconvenience this may cause .
is there car parking at this station ?
unfortunately not , no .
there is at shrub hill though : )
no worries , just checking
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: cycle race closures : your comments
text: local residents and businesses have been complaining about plans to close roads around bewdley , bromyard and great witley for up to nine hours while a cycle race takes place .
about 15,000 riders are expected to take part in the velo birmingham which takes place in september .
here are some of the comments you 've been making on the bbc hereford & worcester facebook page .
events like this cause utter chaos , causes traffic to be diverted , local businesses to lose money . ''
how can it be legal to 'race ' on a public road ?
a road which those cycling 'people ' have never paid a penny towards ? ''
velo birmingham says road closures are necessary to guarantee the safety of the cyclists , and that it 's working with local businesses to minimise disruption .

documents.title: slideshow : wet blooms and soggy sheep
text: the rainy start to the day has n't stopped the bbc 's army of weather watchers from taking some great photos this morning .
this selection come from mikesnapper , coco cholet , j at severn ridge , postman les and johnqa .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: your sas memorial window
text: a special stained glass window and sculpture in hereford cathedral , paying tribute to the link between the regiment and the city , .
is due to be unveiled next month .
the new # sasascension window at # hereford # cathedral has 3000 pieces of parallax glass in 40 different colours # herefordshire # stainedglass

documents.title: watch : 'i 'm very happy to put pen to paper '
text: worcester warriors prop ryan bower says he 's `` very happy to put pen to paper '' after signing a two-year deal with the club .
the forward says he 's confident the club , who are second from bottom in the premiership , are heading in the right direction .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: doctor defends changes at drop-in centre
text: doctors say proposed changes to some gp services in hereford city will only improve the way patients are treated .
the drop-in centre at asda is changing to a gp practice , which will give its own patients access during the day and those registered with other doctors care at weekends and in the evenings .
more than 4,000 people have signed a petition objecting to the plans .
dr ian tait , a gp in bromyard , insists the change means patients will get a better service .
what we are trying to do is to move services on .
the nhs is often questioned on its ability to adapt to change and meet the future needs of its population .
it 's been known for some time that patients who are registered with a gp get better care over the period of their life and get a better outcome . ''
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: arctic expedition challenge for hereford man
text: a 34-year-old with an eye condition took on the hardest challenge he has faced with an expedition in the arctic .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: fears over road closures for cycle race
text: businesses in parts of herefordshire and worcestershire say planned road closures for a charity cycle ride will leave them out of pocket .
velo birmingham will see 15,000 cyclists go through places like bewdley , great witley and bromyard this september .
the roads will be closed for nine hours .
gill edmunds , who is the owner of the great witley tea rooms , based at the ruined stately home witley court , fears customers will not be able to get to other local attractions .
unless the people coming to see them come before 7:30 in the morning they are not going to be able to get along these roads - in fact the earlier road closures are from 6:30 in the morning .
i just think if they 'd closed them for a shorter amount of time we 'd have all stood a chance of enjoying it . ''
velo birmingham says the road closures are necessary to guarantee the safety of the cyclists , and that it 's working with local businesses to minimise disruption .

text: the bbc weather watchers have been out and about with their cameras today and it 's fair to say it 's been looking a bit murky in some parts of herefordshire and worcestershire .
our thanks to j at severn ridge , in severn stoke , and johnqa , in lyonshall , for these photos .

documents.title: watch : tonight and tomorrow 's weather for the west midlands

you can also get the latest forecast at any time by heading to the bbc weather website .

BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: appeal following fatal collision in wythall
text: police are appealing for witnesses to a crash in wythall in which the driver died at the scene .
a fiat 500 was being driven along hill lane toward chapel lane at around 09:20 when the vehicle is thought to have left the road and collided with a tree .

documents.title: former trade minister says he 's 'delighted ' that article 50 has been triggered
text: lord digby jones says that countries will continue to trade with the uk post-brexit .
lord jones , from worcestershire , who served as the trade minister in gordon brown 's government , says negotiations will be difficult , but the end result wo n't result in `` armageddon '' .
it follows theresa may 's decision to trigger article 50 - the two-year process in which the county will leave the eu .
we 've got loads and loads of countries all over the world saying when you 're free from the eu we 'd love to trade with you . ''
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: worcestershire residents voice concerns over forthcoming charity bike ride
text: people living and working along the route of an upcoming charity bike ride through worcestershire say they fear the event will cause major disruption .
the velo birmingham takes place in september and will see roads closed through parts of bewdley , great witley and bromyard as up to 15,000 cyclists take part in the 100-mile event .
but some local businesses say they 'll be out of pocket due to the road closures and have criticised the lack of consultation .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: worcestershire dementia project to be rolled out across the country
text: a worcestershire project which enables dementia sufferers and their carers to relive past memories is set to be rolled out across the country .
museums worcestershire is behind the scheme , named suitcase stories , which allows participants to interact with a series of items collected from the 1940s , 50s and 60s .
their reactions to the objects , such as old and carbolic soap , are then used to create live performances at dementia cafes .

documents.title: cash-strapped council hires consultants on £ 440 a day
text: cash-strapped council chiefs in worcester have come under fire for spending `` massive '' sums of money on outside consultants .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: appeal to help seven-year-old hereford girl with rare skin condition
text: the family of a girl from hereford who suffers from a rare skin disorder is attempting to raise awareness of the condition .
alicia treagus is seven years old and has ichthyosis , which means her skin continuously becomes dry and scaly .
her mum vicki is now trying to raise money for a special bath that will help her cope with her disorder .
author: Stewart Kingscott
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: droitwich and worcester 's bath road among 'most normal ' places in england
text: droitwich spa and bath road in worcester are among the most normal places in england , according to statisticians .
asi data science analysed elements such as age , ethnicity , marital status , property ownership , employment , euroscepticism , the 2015 election vote share , income , and house prices .
doitwich spa was narrowly beaten by didcot , in oxfordshire , to the title of most normal place in england , with worcester 's bath road coming in in third place .

documents.title: your spring morning in kings norton
text: this lovely was taken by team rubo , in kings norton .
blue skies and bright flowers , what more can you want from a spring morning ?
if you have a you 'd like to share , sign up and become a bbc weather watcher here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : alvechurch and westfields suffer league defeats
text: it was a poor night for local football clubs competing in the midland football league premier division .
the league leaders , alvechurch , slipped to a rare home defeat when they were beaten 1-2 by long eaton united , while westfields went down 3-1 at coleshill town .
ft church 1-2 @ twitterid did n't see that coming and that really does now make things interesting .
credit to them outplayed us tonight
full-time : coleshill town 3-1 westfields .
beckley '17 ham '60 weale '81 leek '85
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: woman dies after crashing into a tree in wythall
text: a woman has died after her car crashed into a tree in wythall this morning .
author: Bromsgrove Standard

documents.title: golfing hub plans set to tee off in worcester
text: a nine-hole golf course , owned by worcester city council , is to be leased to a local club .
on a long-term basis .
ravenmeadow golf centre will extend its short-term arrangement to run the course at perdiswell park .

as part of the lease , the club will be able to permanently extend its course to 18 holes , seek planning permission for an improved driving range and build a new family friendly adventure golf course .
author: Simon Glover
BBC Online

documents.title: campaign to honour munitions workers reaches the pm
text: hereford and worcester 's campaign to gain recognition for the thousands of people , including amy hicks ( below ) , who worked in the munitions factories during the two world wars has been raised with the prime minister .
thousands of people , mainly women , worked in the factories at rotherwas in hereford and blackpole in worcester .
they were known as the canary girls as the chemicals turned their hair and skin yellow .
today , bill wiggin , the mp for north herefordshire , raised the campaign with theresa may in the house of commons and she agreed to look at ways in which their work could be recognised .

i know that the department for business would be happy to work with him [ bill wiggin ] to look at further ways to look at further ways to recognise the collective effort of former munitions workers . ''
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: coming up on bbc midlands today : call for more investment in face of brexit
text: business leaders are calling for more investment across the midlands to help the region compete after brexit .
it comes on the day of the formal go-ahead for the uk to leave the european union .
since the referendum last year it 's been a mixed across the region with some firms winning new contracts , while others have seen orders decline .
you can find out more on bbc midlands today at 13:30 on bbc one .
author: Amy Cole
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: worcestershire mum 'breaks down ' while giving evidence in court
text: the worcestershire mother of a 13-month-old boy who drowned in a bath has broken down in tears while giving evidence at worcester crown court today .
lisa passey , 28 , from tenbury wells and her former partner wayne dale , who 's 45 , are both charged with gross negligence manslaughter after their son kian dale died in 2015 .
the trial continues .
author: Alistair Binney
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: breakinghereford fc league trophy presentation details announced
text: hereford fc has announced it 'll be presented with the southern league division one south & west trophy on saturday 22 april .
the bulls clinched a second consecutive promotion at the weekend with six games to spare - after thrashing salisbury 4-0 .
in a statement , the club says full details of the presentation will be confirmed nearer the time .
author: Simon Glover
BBC Online

documents.title: mrs may triggers an indefinite article
text: mrs may triggers an indefinite article
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: worcester businessman calls for 'strong trading relationship ' with europe post-brexit
text: a businessman from worcester says the government must focus on retaining a strong trading relationship with europe , on the day that article 50 is triggered .

ric cipriani , from the manufacturing group southco , says the current level of trade between the uk and the eu should remain `` as close as possible '' as theresa may formally begins the two-year brexit process .
as we reported earlier , the prime minister has written a letter to the president of the european council , donald tusk , which is set to be delivered in brussels imminently .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: worcestershire fortune teller using asparagus to predict french election outcome
text: a worcestershire fortune teller , who claims she can tell the future using asparagus , has been asked to predict the outcome of the forthcoming presidential election on french tv .
jemima packington - who 's known as an `` asparamancer '' - is filming with l'emission du antoine , a programme known for its political satire .
she 'll be using the first of this season 's vale of evesham asparagus to make her prediction .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: breaking : ryan bower signs new warriors deal
text: worcester warriors prop , ryan bower , has agreed a new deal to remain at sixways .
he made 27 appearances in his first campaign , after signing from leicester tigers in 2014 , and has gone on to play 52 times for the club .

documents.title: new managing director appointed at worcester city council
text: david blake has been appointed as the new managing director of worcester city council , following a vote at last night 's full council meeting .
it follows the departure of former md sheena ramsey last month .
the selection panel says mr blake has been chosen due to his `` tireless work '' for the good of worcester .
it is an honour to be named as the new managing director .
i am committed to helping create a bright future for the city and to transforming the council to deliver an excellent service for all our residents . ''
author: Simon Glover
BBC Online

documents.title: damning ofsted report rates dines green primary school 'inadequate '
text: a primary school has been rated inadequate in a damning inspection report which highlights `` serious flaws '' in its ability to keep children safe .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: herefordshire mp says a brexit deal is 'in the interests ' of both parties
text: the mp for north herefordshire , bill wiggin , says it 's in the interests of the uk and the european union to agree a deal over brexit .
it comes on the day prime minister theresa may .
formally triggers the two-year process in which the country will leave the eu .
she 's written a letter to the president of the european council , donald tusk , which will be delivered in brussels just after midday .
we are their [ the eu ] biggest customer and the one rule in business is that you should be nice to your customers .
i think it 's in everybody 's interests on both sides that we come to a sensible , practical and amicable agreement . ''
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: 'all being done ' to prevent threats to local communities , says west mercia pcc
text: the west mercia police and crime commissioner , john campion , has reaffirmed the force 's ongoing commitment to public safety .
it comes a week on from the terrorist attack in westminster , which left five people dead and and around 50 injured .
in a statement , mr campion thanks west mercia officers for their dedication and reassures the public that `` all that is needed '' is being done to prevent threats to local communities .
our thoughts remain with the victims of the attack in westminster .
we will be forever indebted to those that make the ultimate sacrifice to keep us safe . ''
author: West Mercia Police

documents.title: rugby : warriors ' winger banned for two weeks
text: worcester warriors ' winger bryce heem will serve a two-week ban after pleading guilty to tackling a jumper in the air during sunday 's aviva premiership match at wasps .
the panel accepted there were some mitigating circumstances , but deemed the players actions to be reckless .
the ban will mean heem will miss the matches against sale sharks and bath .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: funeral for eight-year-old callum cartlidge
text: hundreds of family and friends have paid tribute to eight-year-old callum cartlidge , whose funeral was in redditch yesterday .
he died on 3 march , less than 24 hours after being discharged from the worcestershire royal hospital .
he then .
suffered a cardiac arrest at home after developing suspected sepsis .
paramedics were allegedly told to take him 18 miles ( 29km ) to worcestershire hospital and not nearby alexandra hospital in redditch , which stopped admitting children to a & e in september .
children and teachers from matchborough first school were among the congregation .

documents.title: stoke prior residents call for log burner firm to close over safety fears
text: concerned residents are calling for the axe to fall on a `` poisonous '' wood burner site , which they claim is billowing harmful fumes into homes and making children ill .
author: Droitwich Spa Advertiser

documents.title: rspca reports rise in animal cruelty claims
text: the number of animal cruelty cases in worcestershire reported to the rspca rose to almost 1,600 last year , the charity said - 83 more than in 2015 .
that 's despite only 16 convictions in herefordshire and worcestershire in 2016 .
nationally , the charity investigated more than 400 allegations of animal cruelty per day .

among the cases the rspca dealt with across the west midlands include a royal python and boa constrictor that were both decapitated with a pair of scissors and a terrier that was so hungry he tried to eat his own fur .

documents.title: watch : a wet start for the west midlands - here 's the rest of today 's forecast
text: you can also keep up-to-date with the latest weather for your part of the region through the bbc weather website .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning - welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to herefordshire and worcestershire live on wednesday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can .
email , .
tweet us on @ twitterid .
or message via .
facebook .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 wednesday .
keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: leominster restoration firm to feature on diy sos
text: leominster-firm la roche restoration will feature on wednesday evening 's episode of diy sos .
the episode features the story of charlotte and her husband rob , who live in neighbouring monmouthshire .
charlotte suffered a stroke when she was giving birth to her twin sons .
she is living with speech loss and partial paralysis but is now back home .
the design of their house is not safe for charlotte to move around in and there 's no space for her to do physio .
that 's where diy sos steps in , along with hoards of volunteers .
the show airs tomorrow night on bbc one at 21:00 .

documents.title: two-week suspension for worcester warriors winger
text: warriors winger bryce heem has been handed a two-week suspension for `` tackling the jumper in the air '' .
a disciplinary hearing was held in bristol yesterday where heem pleaded guilty to the offence .

documents.title: weather : some rain overnight and cloudy tomorrow
text: there is plenty of cloud and some showers forecast overnight , but temperatures wo n't drop much below 9c ( 48f ) .
tomorrow will be another cloudy day , but the rain should go .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: stunning sunset in redditch
text: regular snapper paul wilde sent in this stunning from abbey meadows in redditch .
become a bbc weather watcher here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: man fined for street fight in ross-on-wye
text: a 27-year-old who punched a man in a ross-on-wye street has been fined .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: murder charge after man 's death
text: murder charge after man 's death

documents.title: your spring afternoon
text: it 's taken a while , as it 's been a very misty , overcast morning , but here are two lovely courtesy of our bbc weather watchers .
this one was taken in aylestone park , hereford by lounik .
toppo took this snap in doddenham ; there are plenty of blue skies hiding beneath those clouds .
become a bbc weather watcher here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: cyclist put brick through driver 's car
text: a cyclist has put a brick through the window of a car in bromsgrove following a disagreement with the car owner about right of way .
the cyclist allegedly became aggressive and verbally abusive before following the car back to the driver 's home .
west mercia police says the cyclist , who is a white man aged between 25 and 30 of a tall , thin build , became `` agitated '' before swearing and putting the brick through the car window .
the incident that happened in worcester road on 14 march at about 10:45 .

documents.title: keyes building up for architect award
text: the keyes building in worcester has been nominated for an award by the royal institute of british architects .
the building opened in 2015 and is part of king 's school .
congratulations , a well deserved nomination for a brilliant worcester building
shortlisted in @ twitterid # ribaawards : the keyes building , worcester by @ twitterid © martine hamilton knight

documents.title: mourners pay tribute to eight-year-old boy
text: the funeral of an eight-year-old boy from redditch has taken place .
callum cartlidge , .
eight , suffered a cardiac arrest at home after developing suspected sepsis , sources told the bbc .
a horse-drawn carriage has taken the body of callum cartlidge from his family home to the town 's crematorium .
paramedics treating callum were told not to take him to the alexandra hospital , which was closer to his home , but to the worcestershire royal , where paediatric services were moved last year .
last week callum 's family took part in a protest against the removal of more services from redditch to worcester .
author: James Pearson
Journalist, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: award-winning marmalade maker from worcester drops in to the studio
text: meet worcestershire 's marmalade queen .
annie watson , from .
cakebole orchard , scooped two gold , three silver and two bronze awards , plus six commendations , for her home-made marmalade at the recent international marmalade awards .
this morning she dropped in to my show to try to convert me .
i 've never like marmalade , but i do now .
author: Malcolm Boyden
Presenter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: bromsgrove museum hosts launch of british phone box book
text: a new book examining the history and evolution of the phone box is being launched in worcestershire .
the british phone box tells the story of its beginnings in the 19th century , through the era of the famous red box and more modern 21st century designs .
the launch is happening at avoncroft museum of historic buildings , in bromsgrove .

documents.title: 'exposed ' knife-wielding man targets dog walker
text: a woman walking her dog in the early hours in redditch was approached by a knife-wielding man - who was also exposed .
the man , described as being aged about 30 , white and 6ft ( 1.8m ) tall , demanded the victim hand over her personal belongings .
he did not take anything and fled the scene , after the woman 's dog jumped up at him .
his victim , aged in her 60s , was left shaken .
west mercia police is investigating the attack that happened along a path that runs between bromford hill park and redstone close .

documents.title: union criticises plans to shake-up fire service staffing
text: proposals to change how fire stations are staffed in herefordshire and worcestershire have been criticised by the fire brigades union .
the fire service had reversed an earlier proposal to reduce the number of firefighters on each of the stations ' main engines from five to four .
it now could mean only retained staff are used at evenings and weekend in malvern and evesham .
steve gould , from the fbu , says that 's unsafe and wants more money to be invested .
hereford & worcester fire and rescue service 's area commander said the move would `` increase resilience and capacity '' .

documents.title: leominster-based firm la roche restoration to feature in bbc one 's diy sos tomorrow
text: a leominster- based home restoration firm is set to feature in an episode of bbc one 's diy sos this week .
author: Ledbury Reporter

documents.title: kidderminster harriers : 'need to be at our best ' says defender
text: kidderminster harriers ' central defender jordan tunnicliffe says the tough games keep on coming .
harriers have taken seven points from a possible nine in their past three matches , all of which were against teams in the play-off race .
with fc halifax town due at aggborough on saturday , tunnicliffe says he and his team-mates will again need to be at their best .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: 'carry on as normal ' , says reverend rayman khan of st john 's church after westminster attack
text: the reverend of st john 's church is urging bromsgrove residents to 'show solidarity ' in the wake of westminster 's terror attack .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: man 'felt sick ' after spending silent 24 hours in priest hole
text: we told you yesterday about a man who was spending 24 hours in a 16th century priest hole to raise money for a restoration project .
phil downing , a volunteer at harvington hall , worcestershire , stayed silent in the hole for 24 hours to raise funds for the hall 's restoration trust .
he told bbc hereford and worcester things had got a bit tough towards the end .

i did n't feel sick at all while i was in there , i started getting a headache in the last hour-and-a-half , two hours it was only when i came out and actually got daylight for the first time and stood up i felt sick
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: open verdict on swimming pool manager 's death
text: a coroner has been unable to determine what killed a former manager of the ross-on-wye swimming pool .
blood tests taken after leslie james died at hereford county hospital in 2014 revealed high doses of insulin despite the fact mr james was n't a diabetic .
the coroner delivered an open conclusion at the inquest yesterday .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: world 's finest porcelain produced in worcester set to inspire ceramics lovers visiting spring fair
text: a rare worcester porcelain vase , the largest ever made of its type , and a set of equally rare and precious candlesticks will go on show to the public for the first time ever at a new exhibition celebrating england 's porcelain past .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: new £ 1 : councils in hereford and worcester spend thousands upgrading machines
text: as a new £ 1 coin enters circulation today , our investigation has found local councils have spent almost £ 35,000 updating pay-and-display machines .
it is estimated that one in every 30 £ 1 coins in current circulation is a counterfeit , so the new 12-sided coin has been designed with new security features .
the change means thousands of vending and other coin machines will need to be updated to accept the new coin .
andy chinn , parking manager at worcester city council , says it 's spent £ 14,500 changing 60 machines .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: widow raises money for missing persons charity after husband 's death
text: a woman whose husband drowned is raising hundreds of pounds for the national charity that helped her cope while he was missing .
stephen woolley , 55 , disappeared from his kidderminster home in december after battling depression .
his body was found earlier this month following a social media campaign .
stephen 's wife carole has set up a fundraising page for the charity missing people .
she says she wants to give something back after it supported her .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: breakingman charged with murder after death in kidderminster
text: a man has been charged with murder .
following the death of 55-year-old , police say .
mark beresford , of offmore road , kidderminster , died on saturday from serious head injuries .
henry lewis jones , 22 , also of offmore road , has been charged with his murder and is due to appear before redditch magistrates ' court later .
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: your a misty morning
text: the bbc weather watchers have been sending in some great from the patch .
by all accounts it 's quite a misty morning , the sheep do n't seem too perturbed .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: hereford fc : reborn southern league club win second successive promotion
text: reborn hereford fc have taken another step on their intended climb back towards the football league by winning a second successive promotion .
the phoenix club , created following .
the demise of hereford united in december 2014 , . will play in english football 's seventh tier next season .
saturday 's 4-0 win at salisbury secured the southern league division one south & west title with six games to spare .

documents.title: funeral for eight-year-old who died day after hospital discharge
text: a funeral takes place today for a redditch boy who died less than 24 hours after being discharged from hospital .
callum cartlidge , eight , suffered a cardiac arrest at home after developing suspected sepsis , sources told the bbc .
paramedics treating callum were told not to take him to the alexandra hospital , which was closer to his home , but to the worcestershire royal , where paediatric services were moved last year .
last week callum 's family took part in a protest against the removal of more services from redditch to worcester .

documents.title: worcester warriors winger faces disciplinary panel
text: following his red card at wasps on sunday , worcester warriors ' winger bryce heem appeared before an rfu disciplinary panel in bristol last night .
heem was charged with tacking wasps ' willie le roux in the air .
bryce was unfortunate , but the referee had no choice .
luke is a good ref , he let the game flow and it was fun to watch
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store ?
text: after a dry start with some mist and fog around , it should be a cloudy day with some sunny spells and possibly a few showers later .
top temperatures should be about 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to herefordshire and worcestershire live on tuesday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can .
email , .
tweet us on @ twitterid .
or message via .
facebook .
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: city-based twenty20 to 'rival ipl '
text: city-based twenty20 to 'rival ipl '

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: hereford bypass : welcome support from welsh government
text: leaders of the welsh assembly have pledged its support for the hereford western bypass , citing its `` strategic benefits '' to travel through the midlands and into south wales .
in a letter , ken skates , the welsh government 's cabinet secretary for economy and infrastructure , says he strongly supports the need for a bypass .
a consultation on the road and and the hereford area plan begins next month .
i am delighted to receive such strong support for a hereford bypass from the welsh government .

the bypass is essential for the growth of our city and it is great that the welsh government also recognises the importance of the scheme to improve connections to the road network in south wales and improve links to and from destinations in the west midlands and also to the north west . ''

documents.title: holiday pod breathes new life into a disused church
text: a disused church in herefordshire is to be converted into holiday accommodation , with the help of a `` holiday pod '' .

st michael 's at dulas will become the first church in the country to be converted in this way , expanding the already common practice of dropping pods into churches to provide modern kitchens or loos .
the church closed in 2008 largely because of problems with the roof .

documents.title: top honours for four lions
text: four members of hereford lions club have been honoured for long and distinguished service to lions international , the global humanitarian and community aid organisation which this year celebrates its centenary .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: watch : your west midlands weather forecast for tonight and tomorrow
text: after a bright and sunny afternoon , here 's how tonight and tomorrow are looking .
you can keep up-to-date with the latest forecasts with the bbc weather website .
author: Jennifer Bartram
BBC Weather

documents.title: your photos : the sun peeps through in worcestershire
text: the sun 's breaking the cloud in worcestershire and the daffodils are out in herefordshire .
thanks to bbc weather watchers mikesnapper in lower broadheath and marmite in eastnor who 've captured the day for us with these

documents.title: nhs 'whistleblower ' loses appeal
text: an nhs whistleblower from worcestershire who was struck off for working for a private company while off sick has lost his appeal in the high court today and ordered to pay £ 10,000 in costs .
radiographer ken hall claimed he was the victim of a witch hunt , after raising concerns about thousands of unexamined x-rays at the county 's acute hospitals .
author: Michele Paduano
Health correspondent, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: woman indecently assaulted in evesham
text: a woman who fell over in the street in evesham was .
inappropriately touched by a man who was behind her .
police say the woman fell as she was walking past the rugby club on blind lane last wednesday .
as she got up , a man hit her knee with a stick , knocking her back down , and then indecently assaulted her .
she then kicked the man before he left the scene .

documents.title: libraries declared 'autism friendly '
text: all libraries across worcestershire are now officially `` autism friendly '' according to the county 's libraries and learning service .
staff have attended awareness training and managers have identified a place in each site that can be used by any visitors experiencing sensory overload .
there are also plans to build on the initiative , including film clubs , readers groups and adult learning courses .

we 're really excited about our plans to enable more people than ever to access and benefit from all the wonderful resources and facilities on offer , and staff are looking forward to helping customers on the autistic spectrum to enjoy our libraries . ''
author: Briohny Williams
South East Today reporter

documents.title: craig greener , 18 , gets two-year jail sentence for redditch knife robbery
text: a teenage robber held a knife to another teen 's throat and stole his mobile but the phone 's gps led police straight to his door .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: customers evacuated from coffee shop after fire
text: a coffee shop was evacuated after a fire .
the fire took place in a corridor next to wayland 's yard on foregate street in worcester at 12:45 today .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: the boomtown rats and odyssey to play at worcester
text: the boomtown rats , odyssey and ray lewis from the drifters will all be playing at worcester this summer , as part of the concert of legends at worcestershire county cricket club .
they join billy ocean and the mike and the mechanics singer paul carrack who 've already been announced for the concert on 9 september 2017 .
the newly reformed rats include bob geldof , simon crowe , garry roberts and pete briquette .

documents.title: work begins at worcester racecourse ahead of summer jumping
text: with only a few weeks to go before the summer jumping season opens at worcester racecourse , staff are hard at work preparing the track .
the work takes six to eight weeks - the first race is on thursday 11 may .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: herefordshire ruins preserved including the cobwebs and dust
text: three buildings in hereford and worcester have been shortlisted for the 2017 riba west midlands architecture awards .
they include a 300-year-old ruined cottage in leominster - the croft lodge studios .
many of the original features have been incorporated as part of the conversion , including the rotten timbers , dead ivy , an old birds ' nests , cobwebs and the existing dust .
rather than destroy the original building , designers have encased it in a modern outer shell .
the master 's house in herefordshire took the prize in 2016 .
author: Claudia Berry
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: malvern muslim condemns violence 'in the name of islam '
text: a woman from malvern who converted to islam when she was 18 has defended her religion in the light of last weeks terror attack in westminster .
claudia harris says the koran strongly condemns all acts of violence .

documents.title: white stork makes county village his winter home
text: a white stork which is originally from poland made a county village his home for the winter .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : spanish cat turns up in midlands
text: on midlands today this lunchtime , we 'll have the unusual story of how a cat which turned up in our region has apparently made the journey from spain .
vets found the animal , nicknamed slinky , had been reported missing a month ago in mainland europe .
we 'll find out how it 's though it happened and what the next step is , on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: Joanne Malin
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: man found fatally injured identified
text: man found fatally injured identified

documents.title: police name man who died of head injuries
text: a kidderminster man who died at the weekend from serious head injuries has been named by police as .
55-year-old mark beresford .
he died in hospital on saturday , after paramedics were called to a property on offmore road in the town at around 20:30 on friday .
police say a post-mortem examination indicates his death is unexplained and investigations are continuing to try to establish how he was injured .
a 22-year-old man who was arrested on saturday has been released on police bail until a date in july .
author: Briohny Williams
South East Today reporter

documents.title: hereford win second promotion in a row
text: hereford win second promotion in a row

documents.title: twenty four hours in a priest hole
text: a worcestershire man is nearing the end of a 24-hour stint in an elizabethan priest hole , alone with only a praying mannequin for company .
phil downing is a volunteer at harvington hall and he 's staying silent in the hole for 24 hours to raise funds for the hall 's restoration trust .
in the late 1500 's , when it was illegal to hear mass , catholic families used to hide holy-men in their homes from royal soldiers coming to arrest them .
my main aim is to raise funds for the hall , but i also want to experience what it must have been like for a jesuit priest to have been confined to such a small space for such a long time .
raids could have lasted for days , but i 'm only going to be spending 24 hours with minimal food and drink and no natural light . ''
the hall has seven priest holes in all , more than any other building in england .
author: Nina Das Gupta
Presenter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: 'why was my baby just left to die ? '
text: a mum is calling for changes to hospital guidelines so no other family has to watch their newborn baby struggle alone .
author: Ledbury Reporter

documents.title: man charged with possessing a knife following threatening incident in worcester
text: a man from worcester is due to appear before magistrates this morning , charged with being in possession of a knife in a public place .
it follows an incident on portland street and on a canal towpath at sidbury on saturday night .
the 26-year-old is also charged with using threatening , abusive or insulting words or behaviour to cause harassment , alarm or distress , with intent to cause fear of or provoke unlawful violence .

documents.title: new boss takes up the reins of worcestershire 's troubled hospitals
text: the new permanent chief executive of worcestershire 's acute hospitals begins her first day in the job today .
australian michelle mckay has never worked in the nhs before , but she has run hospitals and a social care charity in her home country , and is a former emergency nurse .
worcestershire acute hospitals nhs trust , which is currently in special measures , says it 's secured a `` world-class leader '' .
author: James Pearson
Journalist, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: hastings reports fit for worcestershire
text: hastings reports fit for worcestershire

documents.title: misty morning in herefordshire
text: there 's plenty of mist and fog around in herefordshire this morning .
thanks to bbc weather watchers johnqa in lyonshall and postman les in bromyard for these beautiful of the countryside emerging through the mist .

documents.title: worcestershire 's joe clarke stars in abu dhabi opener
text: worcestershire batsman joe clarke top-scored with 89 as mcc were bowled out for 332 on the opening day of the champion county match in abu dhabi .
james harris ( 3-49 ) and ravi patel ( 3-83 ) ensured mcc were kept in check .
northamptonshire 's ben duckett made 69 and yorkshire opener alex lees 41 after mcc had won the toss .
and it was mcc 's day when lewis gregory removed sam robson in the four overs middlesex had to face before stumps , middlesex closing 9-1 - 323 behind .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: hereford man 's filipino wife still in the uk
text: a hereford man whose filipino wife is threatened with deportation , was unable to meet the deadline to leave voluntarily , after her flight was cancelled .
marinel bristow came to live in the uk with her husband rob , after a typhoon killed dozens of her relatives and friends in 2013 .
when her legal team failed to win her a few more weeks in the uk to say her goodbyes , marinel bought plane tickets to fly back last night to meet a home office deadline .
i think we 're both shocked and i think it 's absolutely disgraceful how she can be treated like this .
they took her to the airport 10 hours before the flight .
apparently the flight was just cancelled and she was told the flight would be today instead at 12:30 . ''
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: villas plan for worcester 's former st mary 's convent in dramatic overhaul
text: one of worcester 's most historic landmarks has secured a dramatic rebirth - and will become a multimillion-pound `` garden villa '' for 100 pensioners .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: jobs hope for new cyber security centre
text: it 's hoped that a new £ 9m cyber defence centre in hereford will bring a huge economic boost to the county .
the centre for 20 businesses is set to open in 2019 and will run alongside a new cyber security campus being developed by the university of wolverhampton .

one hundred and eighty five jobs in the centre itself , but then hopefully many hundreds going forward once the centre is established it should act as a magnet for other businesses for many years to come . ''

documents.title: rugby : wasps 40-33 worcester warriors
text: the premiership 's top try scorer christian wade scored two tries as leaders wasps moved five points clear with a bonus-point win over worcester .
it was three tries apiece in the first half , wade scoring either side of will rowlands ' try , with josh adams going over twice after bryce heem 's score .
after heem saw red for a tackle on willie le roux , wasps ' alapati leiua , josh bassett and brendan macken scored .
however , biyi alo and jackson willison crossed as warriors gained two points .

documents.title: arrest after 'sus death in kidderminster
text: police have arrested a 22-year-old man after the death of another man in kidderminster at the weekend .
paramedics were called to offmore road in the town at about 20:30 on friday and found a 55-year-old with serious head injuries .
he died in hospital a day later .
police are treating his death as sus
the man 's next of kin has been informed and a post mortem is due to take place .
